CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 8, 1941, pg. 18, reads: "Last Tuesday afternoon, Harry Bobo, promising young heavyweight of Pittsburgh had the privilege of taking a few lessons from one of the greatest defensive boxers of all time, Jack Johnson. Preparing for his important fight with 'Wild Bill' Boyd at the Garden here Monday night, Bobo learned some tricks he will try on his opponent Monday....Bottom: He reaches Bobo how to shoot a powerful left. - Harris photos."
TitMainTitle: Heavyweight boxing champion Jack Johnson, coaching heavyweight boxer Harry Bobo punching another fighter in ring, Centre Avenue YMCA
CatSubject_tab: Men--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Boxers--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Gymnasiums--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Boxing--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Young Men's Christian Association (Pittsburgh, Pa.)Johnson, Jack, 1878-1946.Bobo, Harry.
